page.title: 20SIR WALTER SCOTT
page.content: {Sir Walter Scott}was born in{ {Edinburgh}in{1771}.He bought a farm of 16,00 acres at{Abbotsford}in{1811.}He suffered from polio making one leg shorter than the other.Thus he rode everywhere-often frequenting the{ {George}and{Abbotsford Hotel}in{ {Melrose.}During his lifetime Scott wrote{48 books. }His manuscripts were sold to pay off his debts.First editions of his works and manuscripts are scattered all over the world e.g. the{journal}of the last 6 years of his life is in the Morgan Library{New {York,}the manuscript of{Talisman}is in {Moscow}and the first editions of the {Waverley Novels}are in{Abbotsford {House.}The most well known of Scott's works are{Rob Roy,Ivanhoe}and{The Lay {of the Last Minstrel}which mentions{ {Melrose Abbey.}Scott died in{1832}at Abbotsford,open to public since 1833.
